title: Fix for a leap year bug
body: Calling new d3_time(0, 01, 29) returns Mar 01, since 0 (1900) was not a leap year.

title: Adding y1 to default stackOut
body: SVG Rectangles start at top-left corner (x0,y1).  Providing y1 simplifies rendering and should be backwards compatable.

title: d3.dsv: make it easier to support streams.
body:
We include the current byte position of the end of the row as the third argument to the optional callback.

This allows streaming data to be easily parsed, as the next chunk can be computed using the penultimate byte position as an offset. You can also check for all cases of EOL delimiters at the chunk boundary to avoid re-parsing the last row in a chunk in these cases.

_Edit: removed special null behaviour._

title: Minor simplifications.
body: Removes a few extraneous parentheses that aren't needed due to operator precedence.

title: Fix use of "dx" in examples.
body:
Compared to WebKit, this seems to be handled differently by current versions of Firefox and Opera, [perhaps due to an ambiguity in the spec](http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-svg/2011Dec/0009.html) for when both "dx" and "transform" attributes are set on `<text>` elements.

Hopefully this will reduce a few support requests. :)

title: IE9 and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing)
body: In an example that I was trying to use, I need to go across domains. CORS works well in all browsers except <= IE9. Since most of the examples will work in IE9, I figured I'd add the XDR code to make it work. It did not add much extra to the code. The reason for the url.indexOf was that if there is no CORS, the XDR will not work.

title: d3.format: support align and non-decimal formats.
body: This also fixes a minor discrepancy with Python's implementation: format("013,d")(-42000000) now returns "-0,042,000,000" instead of "-042,000,000".

title: Add d3.geo.path.bounds.
body: This computes the bounding box for a given GeoJSON object using the current projection.

title: Fix for WebKit bad CTM when zoom != 1
body:
Fixes these:
#668

https://groups.google.com/d/topic/d3-js/tqJ_V7cV7Eg/discussion

A good place to test to see the diff is the mouse example.
Also I ran make so it changed d3.v2.js and the min... not sure what the pull request equate is for those files.
All the 'real' changes are in core/mouse.js

I refactored your code a little bit so that there is a d3_mouse_getScreenCTM function that just returns the 'fixed' CTM.

I added some extra code to set the html and body position to 'static' before doing the bug test. This is so that the test is more robust - an insane person might have body or html not be at (0,0) and have position not static.

Example:

``` javascript
d3.select('body')
  .style('position', 'absolute')
  .style('left', 0)
  .style('top', '10px');

window.scrollTo(0, 10);
```

Add this to your code and it would trick the regular d3.mouse function to think that bug44083 exists when it might not.

title: Add support for parsing weekdays and week numbers.
body: Also includes support for parsing "%" literals.

title: Update to UglifyJS v1.3.3.
body:
Save 108 gzipped bytes!

Also, update node-canvas to 0.13.0 for better compatibility with Node.js 0.8.x.

title: Automate d3.time.format and d3.format locale generation.
body:
This avoids having to include a large number of locales in the D3 repository itself, and also reduces the potential for typos when transcribing locale mappings. Even if we do want to include many locales, we can include this as a script for easily generating them.

Ideally the generated locale file should be deleted, otherwise unnecessary locale files could be left lying around. A change in the LOCALE environment variable is not currently detected by the Makefile, so I wonder if the current locale should be stored in some kind of dot-file so a change can be detected. Is there a standard way for doing this?

title: Add en_GB locale for d3.time.format.
body: The only difference between this and en_US is `d3_time_formatDate = "%d/%m/%y"`.

title: Add d3.interpolateStringMissing.
body:
Instead of immediately replacing missing start numbers with the corresponding end numbers, d3.interpolateStringMissing interpolates from an arbitrary starting number to each end number.

This is especially useful for working around some browsers that automatically remove optional zeroes from the SVG transform attribute. Rather than using d3.tween with d3.interpolateString, d3.interpolateStringMissing(0) should be more robust.

See #746.

title: Add cubic polynomial splines
body:
Currently hermite splines are being used in a lot of places when you want to generate graphs of functions. Unfortunately these create bezier curves which may reverse eg
http://bl.ocks.org/3315490 and http://bl.ocks.org/3316746

This can be solved by choosing control points that create regular polynomial splines
see http://bl.ocks.org/3316815 and http://bl.ocks.org/3316859

Tests are broken here because the generated paths have changed

title: Issue with DOM Leaks and with visulizations using the packtree layout parents having only one child are obscured.
body: If you use the http://mbostock.github.com/d3/ex/pack.html chart (or any other visualization based the packtree layout); and your parent circle only has one child; the parent is obscured by the child as the calculation makes the parent.size = child.size.    Not sure if this is the best solution; but added code to make parent.size = child.size \* 1.5; in the event the parent only has one child.   Which causes the parent to be visible if it only has one child.

title: Updates to XHR API
body: See my comments in #369

New features:
- selection.attr and similar methods now accept [multi-valued maps](http://bl.ocks.org/3305515)
- added [d3.lab, d3.hcl](http://bl.ocks.org/3014589) and d3.interpolateLab, d3.interpolateHcl
- added [d3.tween](http://bl.ocks.org/3305854)
- added [d3.tsv](http://bl.ocks.org/3305937)
- added [localization for d3.time.format](http://bl.ocks.org/3306234) (including fr_FR and ru_RU)
- added [d3.scale.threshold](http://bl.ocks.org/3306362)
- added [outer padding](http://bl.ocks.org/3310560) for d3.scale.ordinal rangeBands
- added [d3.layout.pack padding](http://bl.ocks.org/3007180)
- added [custom interpolators](http://bl.ocks.org/3310323) for d3.svg.line and d3.svg.area
- added [d3.random.logNormal](http://bl.ocks.org/3048166) and [d3.random.irwinHall](http://bl.ocks.org/3048450)
- improved [d3.time.scale nice](http://bl.ocks.org/3306147)
- fixed [monotone interpolation](http://bl.ocks.org/3310233)
- simplified [transform interpolation](http://bl.ocks.org/3173784)

title: Allow static localization of d3.time.format.
body:
You can now build a locale-specific version of d3.time.format. For example,

``` bash
LOCALE=fr_FR make
```

will pull strings from the time/format-fr_FR.js file, rather than en_US.

title: Custom interpolators for transition.{attr, style}.
body: Fixes #747.

title: Added capability to wrap d3 as an AMD module.
body:
To generate a wrapped d3, do:

```
$ make MODULE_TYPE=amd
```

The wrapped d3 will be found in d3-amd.v2.js and d3-amd.v2.min.js.

title: selection.enter.insertInOrder
body: This spawned from the discussion on #732.  Rather than take a functional argument to `insert`'s `before` argument, a more specialized function seems to make more sense here.

title: Fix rotate transforms with non-zero origin.
body:
Previously, only the angle was being interpolated. Unfortunately, it looks like the origin information is lost when converted to a matrix, so I don't think there's any way to interpolate the angle and origin directly unless of course we parse the string ourselves. :) For example, "rotate(0 100 100)" becomes the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

Interpolating the matrix decomposition seems better than dropping the origin altogether.

Edit: clarified why loss of origin information is problematic.

title: Fix nice implementation for time scales.
body: The previous implementation didn't handle polylinear domains correctly.

title: d3.timer: use high resolution timer if available.
body:
This allows us to measure time with sub-millisecond precision, which can make transitions more precise. Currently only supported in Chrome.

See also:
- http://updates.html5rocks.com/2012/05/requestAnimationFrame-API-now-with-sub-millisecond-precision
- http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/webperf/raw-file/tip/specs/HighResolutionTime/Overview.html
